page.title: 18CHIGWELL ROW WATERWORKS
page.content:
The Chigwell Row Waterworks is run by the Essex Water Company.
The untreated water mainly comes from Chingford Reservoir. The water comes in as dirty water and is treated with two chemicals one called Chlorine which cleans the water and the other is Ammonia which is a stabiliser for the Chlorine. The water is also filtered. The filterbeds have about two feet of sand at the bottom.This is at the bottom so that all the Algae and dirt stays at the bottom and the clean water goes to the chemical tanks where Chlorine and Ammonia is added. When the water is clean it goes to parts of Ilford, Dagenham, Barking, Romford, Hornchurch and as far as Tilbury.
